get.description: Check if the API and database are operational

post.description: Create a new pipeline with optional tags.

schema.title: Response Read Pipelines Api V1 Pipeline Get

get.description: Retrieve a specific pipeline by ID.

post.description: Create a new Input and link it to the specified Pipeline.

get.description: Get all Inputs associated with a specific Pipeline.

schema.title: Response Read Inputs Api V1 Pipeline  Pipeline Id  Input Get

get.description: Get a specific input, ensuring it actually belongs to the pipeline.

delete.description:
Deletes the Input object entirely. 
Note: Because of Cascade rules, this will also remove the link in PipelineInput.

post.description: Create a new Output and link it to the specified Pipeline.

get.description: Get all Outputs associated with a specific Pipeline.

schema.title: Response Read Outputs Api V1 Pipeline  Pipeline Id  Output Get

get.description: Get a specific output, ensuring it actually belongs to the pipeline.

delete.description:
Deletes the Output object entirely. 
Cascade rules in DB will automatically remove the link in PipelineOutput.

post.description: Create a new Transformation logic block and link it to the Pipeline.

get.description: Get all Transformations associated with a specific Pipeline.

schema.title: Response Read Transformations Api V1 Pipeline  Pipeline Id  Transformation Get

get.description: Get a specific transformation, ensuring it actually belongs to the pipeline.

post.description: Create a new Flow (connection between nodes) and link it to the Pipeline.

get.description: Get all Flows (connections) associated with a specific Pipeline.

schema.title: Response Read Flows Api V1 Pipeline  Pipeline Id  Flow Get

get.description: Get a specific flow, ensuring it actually belongs to the pipeline.

post.description:
Add a tag to a pipeline. 
Logic: 
1. If tag exists by name, use it. 
2. If not, create it.
3. Link it to the pipeline (if not already linked).

get.description: Get all Tags associated with a specific Pipeline.

schema.title: Response Read Tags Api V1 Pipeline  Pipeline Id  Tag Get

delete.description:
Remove a tag from a pipeline (Unlink).
Does NOT delete the tag itself, as it might be used by other pipelines.

post.description:
Trigger a comprehensive validation check on the pipeline.
Checks:
1. Connectivity: Can we reach the Kafka Brokers?
2. Structure: Are there cycles or invalid connections?
3. Schema: Do the data types align?

Start the pipeline execution.
Spins up a background worker that consumes Kafka -> Transforms -> Produces Kafka.

Stop the pipeline execution.
Gracefully disconnects consumers and producers.

get.description: Get real-time metrics from the running background task.
Root endpoint - confirms API is running.

HealthResponse.title: HealthResponse
HealthResponse.description:
Response model for health check endpoint.

Pydantic automatically:
- Validates the data structure
- Generates OpenAPI/Swagger documentation
- Serializes to JSON

NodeType.title: NodeType
NodeType.description:
Enum defining the types of nodes in a flow.

A flow connects nodes, which can be inputs, outputs, or transformations.
